> If each technique reqults in some sort of confidence value then it 
might 
> beneficial to evolve a network that accpets these confidence 
values as 
> inputs rather than using hard defined weightings. Such a network 
may be 
> able to pick up on more complex relationships between the 
different 
> techniques. e.g. if techniques 1 & 3 say it's junk but 2 doesn't 
then 2 
> can be assumed to be right, in other scenarios though 2's answer 
may be 
> safely ignored. Of course there may be far more complex 
relationships 
> than this... or maybe not :)
> 
> Colin.

Yes, interesting idea. In my opinion, such summation may have 
benefit if input vector doesn't have contradictory values, but 
practically the statistical filter could start treat spam as 
legitimate only because spammers found new way to trick the parser.
